document_data.name: Vorkani Mountains
document_data.mainbody: The '''Vorkani Mountains''' were a mountain range that arced across the land of [[Koryo]] in [[northeast Kara-Tur|northeastern]] [[Kara-Tur]], lying at the end of the great [[Koryo Peninsula]]. They were also known as the '''Sillan Mountains'''.<ref group="note">The Sillan Mountains are not located on a map, but are said to hold the headwaters of the Malu River. Maps of Koryo in ''Kara-Tur: The Eastern Realms'' and ''The Forgotten Realms Atlas'' appear to show the Malu emerging from the Vorkani Mountains. Therefore, it is assumed that these are the same mountain range.
document_data.Geography: The headwaters of the [[Malu River]] lay high in the Sillan Mountains.
document_data.Locations: The Vorkani Mountains defined much of Koryo as a rough mountainous country. The towns of [[Manchar]] and [[Xi]] lay in or close beside the Vorkani Mountains, and the village of [[Mu Tong]] stood near the source of the Malu River. The mountains separated the settlements of [[T'o na'Chee]] and [[Xi]] from the rest of Koryo. One could view the mountains from [[Xai Chung]].
document_data.Fauna:
The monstrous [[Krestung]] lurked in the depths of the Vorkani Mountains. Packs of these creatures raided even the best-guarded caravans, snatching away horses and humans alike.

There were also [[giant spider]]s to be found in the mountains.
document_data.Rumors and legends:
It was told that the ancient [[Han people]] had hidden a great hoard of [[jade]] somewhere in the Sillan Mountains.
